children.subject: Nominees can be from both majors! Please note that some awards have a focus (eg: CS) but can be from either program.
Can nominees also be L&S CS students or is it just for EECS students?

history.content:
Dear EECS Students: The EECS Department invites nominations from faculty, students and staff for the EECS 2015 Student Awards.  Some awards may have multiple recipients. Nominations may be submitted through the EECS Student Awards website until midnight Friday, March 6. Please consider nominating an undergraduate or graduate student now!

Undergraduate Awards

 

Research
C.V. Ramamoorthy Distinguished Research Award
This award is for any student based on outstanding contributions to a new research area in computer science and engineering.

 

Breadth
The Samuel Silver Memorial Scholarship Award
This award is presented annually to an Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences student, either undergraduate or graduate, who best combines intellectual achievement in science and engineering (in the classroom or in research activities) with serious humanistic and cultural interests. 

 

Academic Achievement
Arthur M. Hopkin Award (EE)
This award honors an outstanding Electrical Engineering undergraduate who demonstrates seriousness of purpose and high academic achievement. To be used by the student for furthering his/her education.

 

Mark D. Weiser Excellence in Computing Scholarship (CS)
This scholarship provides merit-based tuition for undergraduate students pursuing degrees in Computer Science.

 

Personal Triumph
Eugene L. Lawler Prize (CS)
This prize honors a computer science undergraduate, graduate or reentry student from a disadvantaged group, such as disabled, ethnic minority, or a person who has surmounted unusual difficulties in pursuing a degree and while demonstrating academic effort.

 

Innovation
James H. Eaton Memorial Scholarship 
This award is for an EECS undergraduate student who has demonstrated a keen sense of creativity and inventiveness.

 

Military Service
James Tullock Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is intended for EECS undergraduate and graduate students who are veterans of any branch of the U.S. Armed Forces.

 

Design
Warren Dere Design Award 
This award presented to a graduating senior in EECS whose accomplishment in engineering design is judged to be most outstanding. Evidence might include accomplishments during a co-op or internship assignment or on a summer job, or achievements on a project for an upper division design course.

 

Nonlinear Science
Leon O. Chua Award 
This award is presented annually to an undergraduate or graduate student, or to a recent alumnus, for outstanding achievement in an area of nonlinear science from any discipline, including biological, engineering, mathematical, physical and social sciences.

 

 

Technology in Support of Service

Kevin K. Gong Memorial Scholarship for Bright Minds and Big Hearts

The Kevin K. Gong Memorial Scholarship for Bright Minds and Big Hearts will provide student support to Computer Science or EECS students (rising sophomores - seniors) who are passionate about using technology to better the world in the College of Engineering at the University of California, Berkeley. This scholarship was established in 2015.

 

 

Graduate Awards


Research
David J. Sakrison Memorial Prize
This prize is offered annually to a graduate student who has completed what is deemed by a faculty committee to be a truly outstanding piece of research. 

 

C.V. Ramamoorthy Distinguished Research Award 
This award can be made to any student based on outstanding contributions to a new research area in computer science and engineering.

 

Breadth
The Samuel Silver Memorial Scholarship Award
This award is presented annually to an Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences student, either undergraduate or graduate, who best combines intellectual achievement in science and engineering (in the classroom or in research activities) with serious humanistic and cultural interests. 

 

Altruism
The Demetri Angelakos Memorial Achievement Award 
This award is presented annually to an Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences graduate student who is beyond the preliminary examination and is proceeding to a doctoral degree. The purpose of the award is to recognize a student who, in addition to conducting his/her research, unselfishly takes the time to help colleagues beyond the normal cooperation existing between fellow students.

 

Entrepreneurism

Sevin Rosen Funds Award for Innovation
This award recognizes innovative technical achievement with potential for entrepreneurial success, awarded annually to an EECS graduate student based on outstanding technical achievement in a research area in computer sciences or electrical engineering.

 

Personal Triumph
Eugene L. Lawler Prize (CS)
This prize honors a computer science undergraduate, graduate or reentry student from a disadvantaged group, such as disabled, ethnic minority, or a person who has surmounted unusual difficulties in pursuing a degree and has demonstrated academic effort.

 

Military Service
James Tullock Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is intended for EECS undergraduate and graduate students who are veterans of any branch of the U.S. Armed Forces.

 

Systems, Communications, Control/Signal Processing
Eli Jury Award
This award is presented to a graduate student or recent alumnus for outstanding achievement in the area of Systems, Communications, Control, or Signal Processing.

 

Nonlinear Science
Leon O. Chua Award  
This award is presented annually to an undergraduate or graduate student, or to a recent alumnus, for outstanding achievement in an area of nonlinear science from any discipline, including biological, engineering, mathematical, physical and social sciences. 

 

_________________________________________________

Submit a Nomination: https://buffy.eecs.berkeley.edu/PHP/awardapp/menu.php?dept=eecs
Nominations Due Friday, March 6 at midnight
history.subject: Call for Nominations: EECS Student Awards
